subject: Re: [junit] test case names
msgSnippet: I usually run JUnit as an Ant task, and it s no problem having it print out the name of each test case it runs as it runs. If you want, you can print the name
messageBody:
I usually run JUnit as an Ant task, and it's no problem having it print
out the name of each test case it runs as it runs. If you want, you can
print the name of each "testXXX()" method to the console directly from
your Java code (I usually only do this for a new test case).

Jeegar Shah wrote:

>Is there any way Junit can print out name of the test case its
>executing ?
>
>
>
